intro: Scirpus longivaginatus, commonly known as the long sheath sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy environments. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowering spikes are usually cylindrical and contain small, wind-pollinated flowers. Scirpus longivaginatus plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wetland organisms.
